Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the database, including data model, scalability, consistency levels, and throughput needs. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Cosmos DB.
Design the database architecture, including partitioning strategy, indexing policies, and data distribution across regions.
Choose the appropriate API model for the database (e.g., SQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Gremlin, Table) based on application requirements.
Create an Azure Cosmos DB account in the Azure portal, specifying the desired API model, regions, and consistency level.
Set up global distribution for the database to ensure high availability and low latency for users across different regions.
Enable security features such as IP firewall, private endpoints, and encryption at rest. Configure role-based access control (RBAC) for database access.
Configure backup policies and test restore procedures to ensure data resiliency.
Customize indexing policies to optimize query performance based on application requirements.
Set the appropriate consistency level (e.g., strong, bounded staleness, session, consistent prefix, eventual) based on application needs.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track database performance, throughput, and latency.
Perform thorough testing of the database, including CRUD operations, query performance, and failover scenarios.
Adjust throughput settings to optimize cost and performance based on application usage patterns.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team.
Ensure the database setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
